results.title: A Time for decision
results.brief_description: Dramatises the problem of the compulsive drinker and considers how his family can find help in attaining a normal life, even though the alcoholic may continue drinking. Shows how communities can have various resources to provide hope and guidance.

results.title: A Time for caring (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Sexual abuse often starts between the ages of 5 and 10 and may continue into the teenage years. This program stresses that teachers and classified staff at schools should be aware of what to look for and what to do in cases of suspected sexual abuse. Narrated by Sandra Baker.

results.title: A Ticket to ride
results.creator_credit: Elisabeth Knight, Keith Gow and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
Explores the lives of four Aboriginal people, two women and two men, who have battled to attain high career achievements and top jobs in Australia. Features Wesley Lanhupuy, MLA Arnhem Land, N.T., Pat O’Shane, Secretary of N.S.W. Ministry of Aboriginal Affairs, Ernie Bridge, MLA Kimberley, W.A. and Marcia Langton, BA, 1st Class Hons, ANU.

results.title: A Ticket in tatts
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and F.W. Thring
results.brief_description: This film stars George Wallace as a disaster-prone stablehand who owns a whistle that can make Cup favorite Hotspur run faster. A sub-plot of the film concerns a high society romance where a young girl has undertaken to marry an ageing suitor if his horse defeats Hotspur in the Cup. Much of the shooting for this film was taken away from the usual studio scene to location scenes at a stud farm near Melbourne, the Flemington racecourse and in the grounds of a palatial Melbourne villa.

results.title: A Thousand suns
results.brief_description: Shows how people in the United States have used energy capabilities to create luxuries never dreamed possible, but have also created a throw away society where little of value endures. Emphasises the importance of creating values that last, such as self-respect and respect for all other living things.

results.title: A Thousand million a year
results.brief_description: The work of the Customs and Excise Department and the many and varied investigations and duties carried out by this department at ports and aerodromes throughout the British Isles, as well as the work of Resident Excise Offices at breweries, distilleries, oil refineries, and petrol storage tanks. One third of the annual revenue of Great Britain, one thousand million pounds, comes from Customs and Excise duties.

results.title: A Thousand hours
results.brief_description: Ray is a pilot for American Airways. He visits some young men to show how important education is for employment demonstrating to this group that the theoretical is required before you can get involved with the practical.

results.title: A Thousand eyes
results.brief_description:
Describes the human eye and the organs of sight of various animals. Shows ways to protect eyes against accidents and strain.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
